question.text: The London Eye is an enormous revolving wheel on the south bank of the River Thames which [attracts|z] millions of visitors each year.
It [was designed|z] in 1993 by the architects David Marks and Julia Barfield for a competition.

params.instruct_panel_str: If you are unsure about how the animation above works click the "Instructions" button for help

mcq_xml.attemptsFailFeedback_str: The interaction will now be completed for you.
mcq_xml.attemptsRemain_xml: <text>You have </text><val id="attempts"/><choose id="attempts"><sgl> attempt</sgl><pl> attempts</pl></choose><text> remaining.</text></attemptsRemain_xml>
mcq_xml.multiAnswerFeedback_xml: <text>You got </text><val id="score"/><text> out of </text><val id="total"/><text> correct.</text>
mcq_xml.markedFeedback_xml: <text>You got </text><val id="percent"/><text>% for this marked interaction.</text>

question.text: Marks and Barfield, who are husband and wife, [didn't win|weren't won|wasn't won] the competition, but they didn't drop their idea.
question.modelAnswerString: Marks and Barfield, who are husband and wife, didn't win the competition, but they didn't drop their idea.

question.text: After some time, British Airways became a partner, and in 1998 the money to build the Eye [was found|found|were found] .
question.modelAnswerString: After some time, British Airways became a partner, and in 1998 the money to build the Eye was found.

question.text: It [was built|built|is built] in five countries in only 16 months.
question.modelAnswerString: It was built in five countries in only 16 months.

question.text: The passenger capsules [were transported|was transported|transported] through France, across the English Channel and then up the River Thames.
question.modelAnswerString: The passenger capsules were transported through France, across the English Channel and then up the River Thames.

question.text: It opened in 2000, and [was voted|is voted|voted] the people's favourite London attraction in the same year! So far, nearly 40 million visitors have travelled on the Eye.
question.modelAnswerString: It opened in 2000, and was voted the people's favourite London attraction in the same year! So far, nearly 40 million visitors have travelled on the Eye.

question.text: The Eye moves slowly, so you [enter|are entered|were entered] a capsule while it is moving. As the capsule ascends, you get wonderful views of London (depending on the weather of course!).
question.modelAnswerString: The Eye moves slowly, so you enter a capsule while it is moving. As the capsule ascends, you get wonderful views of London (depending on the weather of course!).

question.text: The Eye [takes|is taken|was taken] you up 135 metres above the river, which is much higher than that other famous landmark, Big Ben.
question.modelAnswerString: The Eye takes you up 135 metres above the river, which is much higher than that other famous landmark, Big Ben.

question.text: As each capsule descends, a photo [is taken|takes|take], which you can buy later.
question.modelAnswerString: As each capsule descends, a photo is taken, which you can buy later.

question.text: Hundreds of people [are employed|employ|employed] at the Eye and its gift shop. Capsules with guides can be booked for private groups.
question.modelAnswerString: Hundreds of people are employed at the Eye and its gift shop. Capsules with guides can be booked for private groups.

question.text: The safety of the Eye [is checked|checks|are checked] daily and annually.
question.modelAnswerString: The safety of the Eye is checked daily and annually.

question.text: The Eye is open most of the year and has become one of the most popular attractions in the world.
